snippet: The move to reduce the routine use of antibiotics in livestock, which creates drug-resistant pathogens, is far from sufficient.
abstract: Editorial holds Food and Drug Administration's move to reduce routine use of one class of antibiotics in livestock is far from sufficient; urges FDA to consider the public's health as it considers the interests of the farm and pharmaceutical industries who lobbied heavily to limit the scope of this rule.
lead_paragraph: The move to reduce the routine use of antibiotics in livestock, which creates drug-resistant pathogens, is far from sufficient.
